Description: A large, evergreen tree with a dense, rounded crown. Known for its pest-repelling properties and tolerance to drought.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Highly drought-tolerant once established. Can be propagated from seeds or root suckers. Requires minimal watering.

Description: An aromatic perennial plant, considered sacred in Hinduism. It's an erect, much-branched subshrub with hairy stems and simple green or purple leaves.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in full sun and well-drained, fertile soil. Water regularly but avoid waterlogging. Can be grown from seeds or cuttings. Prune regularly to encourage bushy growth.

Description: A herbaceous perennial plant known for its bright orange rhizome, which is used as a popular spice. It has large, oblong leaves.
Growing_Tips: Requires well-drained, loamy soil and a warm, humid climate with significant rainfall. Plant rhizome pieces in spring. Prefers partial shade.

Description: A small, woody shrub with dull green leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that produce an orange-red fruit. Known as an adaptogen.
Growing_Tips: Grows well in dry, sandy, or loamy soil with good drainage. Prefers full sun. It is drought-resistant and requires minimal watering once established.

Description: A creeping, non-aromatic herb with succulent leaves. It commonly grows in marshy areas and wetlands.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in wet, boggy soil and can even grow hydroponically or in aquariums. Requires full sun to partial shade and consistent moisture; must not be allowed to dry out. Propagate easily from stem cuttings.
